item.description: A U.S. immigration agent shot and wounded a man and a woman in Portland, Ore., authorities said today, leading local officials to call for calm given public outrage over the ICE shooting death of a Minnesota woman a day earlier.

item.title: Federal immigration officers shoot and wound 2 people in Portland, Oregon

item.title: Minneapolis ICE shooting brings back painful memories for community
item.description: The 2020 murder of George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police occurred less than a half-mile away from where a federal agent fatally shot Renee Good while she was in her vehicle.

item.title: Anti-ICE protesters assemble in Harrisburg as fallout from Minnesota shooting grows
item.description: Roughly 100 people protested on the Capitol steps Thursday afternoon, a day after an ICE agent fatally shot a woman in Minneapolis.

item.title: Imperial Beach residents mourn Gary Gates and question why deputies shot him
item.description: The killing of Gates, a member of the local unhoused community, has raised questions about how the Sheriff’s Office responds to mental health crises.

item.title: Officer-involved shooting reported inside NYC hospital following knife incident
item.description: Authorities investigate an officer-involved shooting with a knife-wielding suspect at NewYork-Presbyterian Brooklyn Methodist Hospital. NYPD officials have asked the public to avoid the area.

item.title: Former Trump DHS secretary details ICE protocols amid Minneapolis shooting

item.title: Trump’s menacingly dishonest response to the Minnesota ICE shooting

item.title: At Philadelphia vigil for woman killed by ICE in Minneapolis​, attendees demand action: "She was murdered"
item.description: Nearly 1,000 people gathered to express their outrage in Philadelphia Thursday after a woman was shot and killed by an ICE agent in Minneapolis​.

item.title: JD Vance just sharply undercut the Trump team’s ICE shooting narrative
item.description: Mere hours after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent killed a woman Wednesday in Minneapolis, the Trump administration staked out a maximalist position.

item.title: VP Vance defends ICE shooting: ‘A tragedy of her own making’
item.description: Vice President JD Vance provided comments a day after an ICE agent killed a woman in south Minneapolis, saying in part that it was a, “tragedy of her own making."

item.title: Former police commissioner reacts to fatal Minneapolis ICE shooting

item.title: Ex-Husband of Mom Killed By ICE Blows Up JD Vance's Story About Shooting
item.description: The ex-husband of Renee Good, the woman shot by ICE in Minneapolis, has denied Vice President J.D. Vance's claims that she was involved in activism and protest.

item.title: Federal agents clash with protesters day after ICE officer fatally shoots woman
item.description: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman Wednesday morning in south Minneapolis, according to the Department of Homeland Security. A U.S. official identified her as Renee Good. City leaders said the victim was a legal observer of federal actions in the city.

item.title: US: Protesters, officers clash after Minneapolis ICE shooting
item.description: Protesters took to the streets outside the federal building in Minneapolis to voice their outrage a day after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent fatally shot a woman.

item.title: Minneapolis protesters vent their outrage after an ICE officer kills a woman
item.description: An unidentified ICE officer shot Renee Nicole Macklin Good in the head on Wednesday.

item.title: WATCH LIVE: Noem holds news conference after deadly shooting by ICE in Minneapolis
item.description: State and local officials demanded ICE leave Minnesota after the unidentified ICE officer shot 37-year-old Renee Nicole Macklin Good in the head Wednesday morning. But Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said agents won't be going anywhere.
